page.title: 01The area in general
page.content: This is a rural area situated 4\ miles south of the city of Derby in the East Midlands. Within the 12\ Km section there is 1 village,Barrow_on_Trent,and 2 hamlets Twyford and Ingleby plus 16 farms. These settlements are situated within the flood plain of the River Trent bounded by the River Trent to the south,and the Trent_Mersey canal to the north. The area is principally one of farming with the dominant agriculture being Dairy farming, but many of the inhabitants of the settlements are commuters working in Derby. There are many interesting features in the area such as the old church at Twyford,a hermits cave at Ingleby and the relief of the area which has been moulded over many years by the Trent.
